meanings.sent1: She felt muddleheaded after staying up all night studying.
meanings.sent2: His muddleheaded expression showed he didn't understand the math problem.
meanings.sent3: The muddleheaded student tried to write an essay on a topic he knew nothing about.
meanings.sent4: Her muddleheaded mind was like a tangled ball of yarn, impossible to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The muddleheaded professor kept forgetting where he left his glasses.

meanings.sent1: The muddleheaded instructions confused the new employees.
meanings.sent2: The muddleheaded speech left the audience unsure of the main point.
meanings.sent3: His muddleheaded attempt at painting resulted in a messy canvas.
meanings.sent4: The muddleheaded plan was like a blurry picture, hard to make out.
meanings.sent5: The muddleheaded driver missed the turn because he wasn't paying attention.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of clear thinking
meanings.sent1: The muddleheaded decision led to chaos in the office.
meanings.sent2: Her muddleheaded behavior made it hard for others to trust her.
meanings.sent3: The muddleheaded chef accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake.
meanings.sent4: The muddleheaded politician's speech was full of contradictions.
meanings.sent5: The muddleheaded plan fell apart due to poor communication.
